intro: Boerhavia universitatis, commonly known as the university bluemink, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its small, blue-pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has succulent leaves and stems, adapted to store water in its native habitat. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy species for xeriscaping. Its unique coloration and drought tolerance make it a notable ornamental plant in botanical gardens.
